concept.title: Plan Your Installation
concept.shortdesc: In order to get the most out of a deployment, we recommend that you create a plan that provides a complete set of features, performance, scaling, and resilience characteristics you want in your deployment.

conbody.note: If you are upgrading from an existing release, see .
conbody.p: To successfully plan for your installation, you must determine two things:

ul.li: The infrastructure you plan to install on: Think about the application workload performance and resource utilization tuning. Think about how many machines you want on your system.

The amount of control you plan to give on your network: Use your existing architecture and policies to determine the networking features you want to enable: EC2 Classic Networking or EC2 VPC Networking. Think about the public network (not necessarily the IPv4 public space, but the network that users will access), delegating IP addresses to , and firewall rules.

conbody.p: This section describes how to evaluate each tradeoff to determine the best choice to make, and how to verify that the resource environment can support the features that are enabled as a consequence of making a choice.

By the end of this section, you should be able to specify how you will deploy in your environment, any tradeoffs between feature set and flexibility, and where your deployment will integrate with existing infrastructure systems.
conbody.note: For more help in planning your installation, see the , which includes use cases and reference architectures for various deployments.
